intro: Corynanthe lane-poolei, commonly known as the Lane-Poole's corynandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of western Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and leathery, elliptical leaves. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
